snippet: It might take months to come up with a thorough accounting of the direct cost to the taxpayers of putting much of the government out of business.
abstract: Economic research firms say government shutdown will cost the United States economy several billion dollars; also says affiliated damage, like undermining of consumer and business confidence, will be far greater, especially combined with financial effects of near-breach of debt ceiling.

byline.original: By ANNIE LOWREY and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: It might take months to come up with a thorough accounting of the direct cost to the taxpayers of putting much of the government out of business.

headline.main: Shutdown to Cost U.S. Billions, Analysts Say, While Eroding Confidence
headline.print_headline: Shutdown to Cost U.S. Billions, Analysts Say, While Eroding Confidence
